content:
Great choices! You'll definitely enjoy the kanimeshi and namashirasu at those restaurants. And yes, the Yokohama Central Market is a fantastic place to try some grilled squid and other fresh seafood.

As for autumn festivals and events in Yokohama, there are a few happening in the next few weeks. One of the most popular events is the **Yokohama Oktoberfest**, which takes place from mid-October to early November. It's a German-style beer festival with food, drinks, and live music. If you're a beer enthusiast, this might be a fun event to check out.

Another event is the **Yokohama Autumn Leaves Festival** (, Yokohama Koyo Matsuri), which usually takes place in late November. The festival features beautiful autumn foliage, food stalls, and traditional Japanese performances. It's a great way to enjoy the fall season in Yokohama.

Additionally, the **Minato Mirai 21 district** often hosts autumn-themed events and illuminations during the evenings, usually from late October to mid-December. The area is beautifully lit up with festive lights, and there are often street performers and food vendors.

Please note that the dates and details of these events are subject to change, so it's always a good idea to check the official websites or contact the local tourist information center for the latest information.

I hope you find something that interests you and adds to your Yokohama adventure!
